definition:
Let $X$ be a Banach space, and let $X^*$ be the dual space of $X$. For a
function $f \colon X \rightarrow \mathbb{R}$, and $x\in X$, let us
define
$$\partial f(x) = \{r^* \in X^* \; : f(x) - f(y) \leq  r^\ast(x - y) \; \ \mbox{for all} \  y \in X\}.$$
If $\partial f(x)$ is non-empty, then $f$ is *subdifferentiable* at
$x \in X$, and if $\partial f(x)$ is non-empty for all $x$, then $f$ is
*subdifferentiable* [@Zalinescu; @Rockafellar].

[9]{} C. Zalinescu, *Convex Analysis in General Vector Spaces*, World
Scientific Publishing Company, 2002. R.T. Rockafellar, *Convex
Analysis*, Princeton University Press, 1996.
